lines: Halt! Come no closer. You carry a… vibe. Yes… a strange, flickering vibe.
Or perhaps that’s just your natural musk. Baha!
I am Filbert—wizard of the woods, master of mysteries, beater of demons.
Speaking of which—have you seen a squirrel with eyes like forgotten runes? If you do… run.
Do not be fooled. That thing is no squirrel. I fear it is something much, much worse.
A demon—that’s my best hypothesis. A creature from the days of old. Dark and clandestine.
It merely wants you to think it’s a squirrel. But we are not so easily fooled, are we?
I hear it lurks near Clay, the stone fellow. Of course it would. The beast feeds on calmness. And moss.
Now, I know we just met stranger, but I need… No—Pebblewick needs you.
Find this squirrel. Retrieve it for me. I must study it. Very carefully. From a distance. Through a jar.
I discovered magic when I was very young. I was trying to toast a crumpet.
Next thing I knew, the flames had leapt up like great, molten claws and seared my poor crumpet to a crisp!
That was my first ever spell, and it was entirely accidental.
Who knew that one coincidentally recite ancient words when singing gibberish…
After that, I couldn’t not study magic. The symbols, the swirls, the ancient frog chants… Oh, the frog chants!
So, eventually, I left my dank little cave and undertook an epic journey across the lands!
That led me here, but I never forget my roots.
Magic has always been with me. Like a rash. Or a curse. Or a very precious scarf.
Ah, Pebblewick. I chose this town completely at random, you know.
It was a Tuesday. I came upon a humble village. The smell of the moss was pleasant.
At first, I thought I’d hate staying in one place. But there’s something… peaceful here.
There’s nothing to interrupt my studies. It’s grown on me, this place. Like fungus.
Ah! You return.
I smell… something. Determination? Or is that toast?
No matter. Have you questions?
AAH! By the gods, you captured it!
To be frank, I doubted you would succeed.
‘Suicide mission’ probably isn’t the right term, but… Bah! Never mind that.
Now I just need to find a suitable jar, and then the studies can begin!
Just a squirrel? How do you mean?
And its name is… Walnut?
No, no, that can’t be right…
I’m not sure what Clay told you, but it’s clear he doesn’t understand the true nature of this fuzzy fiend!
I don’t understand. Your words—they conjure such a strange feeling in me.
As if my heart is lighter…
Who knew words could carry such magic? Fascinating!
I will have to study this further.
Thank you, my wonderful apprentice.
And Walnut… I apologise if I ever scared you. Would you… Would you care for a biscuit?
You know… I can’t recall a time I wasn’t alone.
From the moment I hatched, it was just me, my cave, and my magic.
But now… there’s you. You talked to me. You listened. You treated me with respect.
Friendship… it’s a magical thing, isn’t it?
And not only that—you introduced me to Walnut! He’s such a funny little fellow.
I believe the term for that is… a ‘two-for-one deal.’ Baha!
WAAH! Mind your paws, bedlamite!
You do know that fiddling with the orb is a dangerous game, yes?
Its power is great, but also grumpy.
What do you want it for, anyway? Hm? Glitter, you say?
You wish to restore the shimmer of a unicorn’s mane? Bah! Nonsense.
Even this orb draws the line at vanity.
Listen well: as unicorns age, their manes lose their sparkle—like stardust drifting off into space.
It's not a curse. It’s nature’s way of saying, ‘You’ve glowed long enough, buddy.’
And aging, dear meddler… is something even the most powerful wizards do not touch.
Not unless they want their eyebrows to swap places with their kneecaps.
Ah, it’s you! My friend! My ally!
Your musk brings great comfort!
I daresay things are looking sideways. Or is it… upwards?
Well, you know what I mean.
